content.help: Enable or disable this mod. Default: OFF
Displays a warning at the start of a game when this mod is disabled. Default: ON

content.text:
Periodic updates: Checks rads every x seconds (update delay) and changes morphs according to current rads level.
Update after sleeping: Every time you go to sleep you get additional morphs according to the current rads. In this update mode you can only restore your body by visiting a doctor.

content.help: Whether to update periodically or only after sleeping. Default: Periodically
Seconds to wait between updating morphs. Only applies to periodic updates. Default: 1s
Multiply the total rads that is considered 100 percent. Higher multipliers means morphs gets applied slower. Default: 1
Determine radiation from actual radiation value (red part of the health bar) or by using a random rads/s value while taking rads in game. Default: Actual radiation
With random rads detection, rads/s will be between this value and the upper limit when taking rads. Total rads go from 0 to 1000.
With random rads detection, rads/s will be between the lower limit and this value when taking rads. Total rads go from 0 to 1000.

content.text:
The following settings are currently only used for deciding if / what morph sound to play. If you don't use these morph sounds, you can ignore these settings.
Only applies to periodic updates.

Do note that the larger the update delay, the larger the rads taken can be.-Any amount of rads taken below Low (incl. rad decreases) will not play any sound.
-Any amount of rads taken between Low and Medium will play the low sound.
-Any amount of rads taken between Medium and High will play the medium sound.
-Any amount of rads taken above High will play the high sound.

content.help: The amount of rads taken which is considered low
The amount of rads taken which is considered medium
The amount of rads taken which is considered high

content.text: A set of optional perks that are used to apply in-game (de)buffs in addition to the possible stripping of clothes/armour. These are dependant on the player's rads, which depending on the chosen Morph updates match the current rad levels or the total accumulated rads since last doctor visit.

content.help: Enable or disable additional perks as your accumulated rads increases

content.text:
An optional risk when using doctor-only reset sliders. Upon reaching maxed-out morphs on all sliders, further radiation accumulation will eventually lead into the non-lethal 'popping' of the player. After 'popping', all morphs are reset and a major debuff will be applied.
This will also replace the negative result of the Experimental RadPurge chem with the player 'popping'.

content.help: Enable or disable non-lethal 'popping' of the player upon taking rads beyond their max morphs. Default: false
When popping, the morphs get increased with each state. The more states, the more extreme the morphs, and the longer the popping takes. Default: 5
Should popping paralyze the player. This will leave the player open to damage during the duration! Default: true
Play sound effect upon taking any sort of radiation when popping is enabled and having reached maxed-out morphs. This will continue until the morphs are reset or the player has popped. Default: false
The state in which the player gets stripped of all clothes and armour. Should be less then total pop states. Set to 0 to disable stripping. Default: 3

content.text: Companions can also be 'popped' in the same way the player can. This only works if player popping is enabled, and there is at least 1 slider set which effects companions. Do note that this will slow down the entire 'popping' process by at least a factor of 3, so if you intend to use this, it is adviced to at least disable ' Pop paralyzes'.

content.help: Enable or disable 'popping' of companions. Default: false
Resets the mod to its initial state without restoring the original body. Does not change any settings.
Shows the lowest slider percentage.
Use in case no companion morphs are applied when they should.
Add 50 irradiated blood to player inventory for rads testing.
Add 1 experimental RadPurge to player inventory.
Add 1 RadPurge to player inventory.
